docs.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON, June 28 (AP) -- The Senate approved a $650-million authorization bill today to establish regional medical centers to fight the nation's three major killers: heart disease, cancer and stroke.

headline.main: SENATE APROVES HEALTH CENTERS; Votes $650 Million as Part of President's Program

docs.abstract: Sen passes bill authorizing Fed aid in staffing community centers for 1st 51 mos of operation; returns it to HR for action on Sen amendments
docs.snippet: WASHINGTON, June 28 (AP) -- The Senate approved a $650-million authorization bill today to establish regional medical centers to fight the nation's three major killers: heart disease, cancer and stroke.
